reviews.review_msg: I love that she has incorporated an anti-oppressive, labour-based approach to her grading. Not sure if she will continue that for future semesters, but everyone's best can look different every day and that is a pretty great accomodation for a class. Lots of heavy but fun, applicable content on computational linguistics that is relevant today!

I'm shocked at this rating, as professor Taboada has been one of the best profs I've ever had in all four years of university! She is clearly passionate about her field of work, with a lot of important research that she contributes to like the Gender Gap Tracker. She is highly organized, accomodating and her lectures are easy to follow!

Prof is sweet, but lectures can get long. It will be tough to pull through if you aren't that passionate about the course content, but overall easy to do well (GPA booster). Throughout the term you'll be working in groups which the assignments given aren't too difficult to complete. She's a good prof for ling.

Lecture slides were sometimes a bit tough to follow, so you'll probably have to re-watch them again. Homework and group projects were easy to understand and a clear application of the course contents.

PROS: great personality; marks quickly; assigns easy weekly hw; publishes exam 1 feedback several weeks before exam 2; cares about ethical implications & current events. CONS: slides are disorganized; likes group assignments; tough marker; docks marks for small stuff. TIPS: be diligent & detailed; take notes; attend class; start studying early.

I would definitely recommend taking this class. It's a super easy class and a good GPA booster. Assignments and quizzes were short and easy. She was very understanding considering the COVID circumstances and she was always gave clear criteria when doing classwork.
Very knowledgeable prof. Very thankful for the weekly discussions and open book quizzes, easy gpa booster. makes me want to take more linguistic courses! would recommend.

LING 100 Amazing Professor, she really tries to engage her audience. She is very approachable and takes her student's concerns seriously. Looking at the reviews of her, I could not disagree more. If you do your work and show up, you'll enjoy the class.

Maite is very knowledgeable in her field. She sometimes delivers her presentations poorly, but reviewing her slides usually clears up any confusion. She's a bit intimidating to speak with tbh. As for readings, it was a good balance between interesting material and boring background info. She let us pick our own topics for assignments, thankfully.

The way she taught it was dry. She didn't even teach, but read through her slides. I had to learn it on my own time. When I asked her a question it just made me more confused. The multi choice is individual, but written is with a group, but the final is all individual. The tests usually had info never taught, read ahead, do the practices
A hot prof with a brilliant mind!!

So RIDICULOUS! Letter grading scheme is ridiculous! 60% is a D? Gives students notes from the textbook and you will still have to read in depth. She does give examples in class for some clarity. Not the worst, but definetly not the best either.
this is a sick class. No textbook needed but really boring but just take notes on her slides and u can get some dcent marks.  Dont buy the textbooks they screew u over

Good teacher, but impossible to change marks on an exam. she is very set in her answers and will not bend to consider someone else's thoughts or point of view. Note of advice for short answer questions: less is more, she doesnt like long answers.

Maite is a reasonable person.  Make sure you go over all the notes, do the exercises that she provides, and come up with & keep asking questions -you have to do this on a weekly basis-.  Show respect, it will be a fun class.  If you study hard enough, you'll get good results.  She is a good prof.
Easy to pass but hard to get high grade.2 Mts and final. all have MC, true false qs, and short answer.she's a nice person but class is a bit boring.generally easy course nice prof.
horrible teacher, difficult exams, never reply my emails.ADVOID her if possible!!worst ling prof ever.
Not a great teacher. Treats students like they are still in High School.  Reasonable exams though.
first midterm was hard, but after u know the format of exams, it'll be better! text book helps a lot, read thru twice/understand everything will def. do good on exams! eventhou its only 50 min!
Contents are boring and DIFFICULT, if its not required, dont take it.

Maite really knows her stuff, she comes to class well prepared and enthusiastic. However, not  enough examples are given which makes the course very difficult.  Not enough time for midterms (only 50 min) and the marking sceme too high (too many pple @ a 'D'). Ling 200 STRONGLY RECOMMENDED!!
she knows her stuff, exams are straight forward, but....she's a picky marker, well with grammer, and only gives u 50 min for the midterms =(
hard to understand; crappy textbook; teach nothing to prepare you for 322; exams are kinda easy
No Comments
No Comments
A very good teacher. Approachable and thorough. Frequently asks for feedback on the course and teaching style.
It's not an easy course.  But she teaches well.
I think she has very nice personality.  She really knows how to teach.  Very clear and organized.

She is a great professor!! Her lecture notes are very organize, informative, and helpful. Exams are also very straight forward. If you attend her lecture all the time and read the textbook, this should be an easy course.

Boring, boring, boring! And more boring! All she does in class is go over the text, chapter by chapter. I can read the text at home by myself, thanks! So many time-consuming assignments of so little value. At least she's not hard, I guess.
Good attitude toward students.
She is too hostile toward student.. huge ego, don't approach her during her offince hours or you will be insulted.
Teaching is SO unclear. Does not make clarify the text.
No Comments
useless lecture, uesless course!  She got offended very often!  Always tell you not to memorize anything just to understand everything... and surely if you listen to her, you are gonna fail...!
No Comments

you don't have to read the book since she'll do it for you in lectures. studying the lecture notes is good enough. her marking scheme is absolutely horrible and unfair. her exams are extremely tricky and difficult.

You cannot ask this Prof questions; she never gives you a clear answer and often gets defensive. The way she divides marks on a test is terrible and if she tells you not to worry, it's going to be a 'sweet' exam, that only means she's going to bring candy
No Comments
Marking system poor, unfair to students. Unprofessional, defensive manner when feels challenged by students. Doesn't mention errors/problems until brought up by students. Avoid her, if possible!
very mean, careful in answering questions, not very helpful....dont have to go to lecture to pass her tests..she just follows the notes anyways..
worst marking scale ever
Too much assigned readings compared to others teaching the course, and horrible marking scale!
No Comments
Why even go to lecture? She just follows the text
No Comments
She tries to please; however it is better off to read the notes and readings
She is very careful when she answers student's questions.tricky prof!
not a very good person in the end.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
uesless lecture.....she can be really mean somtimes
No Comments
She is not very helpful when it comes to answering questions...
